intro: Pimelea elegans, commonly known as the slender pimelea, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, characterized by its narrow, erect stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Pimelea elegans is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal and sandy environments.
